Recent Home Buyers Face Risks From Rising Rates Rock-bottom interest rates and rising house values have been a boon to recent first-time home buyers. But with the Federal Reserve expected to raise interest rates next week, experts worry that home ownership could become harder on the wallet, possibly causing prices to wobble in some vulnerable markets.

Military Spending Approved The Senate passed a $447.2 billion Pentagon spending measure for 2005 that includes a 3.5 percent raise for service personnel. Republicans defeated an amendment to increase veterans benefits.

An Afghan Legacy Saved Kabul's fabled trove of 2,000-year-old Bactrian gold ornaments, feared stolen or lost over decades of turmoil, has emerged intact, after being hidden and saved by a few faithful guardians.

Coronation at the Capital Word that the Rev. Sun Myung Moon donned a crown in a Senate office building and declared himself the Messiah while members of Congress watched during an awards ceremony in March is now causing a stir in Washington.

Saudis Offer Amnesty The Saudi government announced a one-month amnesty for anyone involved in extremist activities. The move appeared to indicate that the country's rulers were confident of their hold on power.
2 Charged in Spam Case Two people, including an engineer working for America Online, were arrested and charged with stealing 92 million e-mail addresses from AOL and then selling them to spammers.
